        public static boolean equals(java.lang.Object o1,
                             java.lang.Object o2)
        Compares two Objects for equality. This allows Objects to be compared with null, and will return true if null is compared to null.
        Parameters:
        o1 - The first Object
        o2 - The second Object
        Returns:
        true If both o1 and o2 are null or the equals() method for the instances returns true

        size - The required size of the array

        Returns:

      • secureMethod

        public static final java.lang.Object secureMethod(java.lang.Class cl,
                                                  java.lang.String methodName,
                                                  java.lang.Class[] paramTypes,
                                                  java.lang.Object instance,
                                                  java.lang.Object[] params)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Invokes a static method or a method on an instance after requesting priviledges required for an Applet to invoke the method successfully.
        Parameters:
        cl - The Class containing the method
        methodName - The name of the method
        paramTypes - The Classes of the parameters for the method
        instance - The instance on which to invoke the method, or null for a static method
        params - The values for the parameters for the method
        Returns:
        The return result for the method
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

                        boolean ascending,
                        boolean caseSensitive)

        ascending - true for ascending order, false for descending order

      • sort

        public static void sort(java.util.Vector v,
                        boolean ascending,
                        java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                        boolean caseSensitive)
                 throws java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException,
                        java.lang.IllegalAccessException
        Sorts a Vector of items using the given method to retrieve the values of the elements.
        Parameters:
        v - The Vector to be sorted
        ascending - true for ascending order, false for descending order
        method - The method to get the values of the elements for sorting
        caseSensitive - true for case sensitive, false to ignore case
        Throws:
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        java.lang.IllegalAccessException

      • getBoolean

        public static boolean getBoolean(java.lang.Object source)
        Gets a boolean from an Object. If the Object is a String and the Upper Case value of the String is one of "TRUE", "T", "YES", "Y" or "1" then the result will be true. If the Object is a Boolean, the result will be the value of the Boolean, otherwise false is returned.
        Parameters:
        source - The source Object
        Returns:
        The boolean value

      • getBoolean

        public static boolean getBoolean(java.lang.Object source,
                                 boolean defValue)
        Gets a boolean from an Object. If the Object is a String and the Upper Case value of the String is one of "TRUE", "T", "YES", "Y" or "1" then the result will be true. If the Object is a Boolean, the result will be the value of the Boolean, otherwise the default value is returned.
        Parameters:
        source - The source Object
        defValue - The default value
        Returns:
        The boolean value

      • dumpBytes

        public static java.lang.String dumpBytes(byte[] buffer)
        Does a Hexadecimal/ASCII dump of a buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to dump

      • dumpBytes

        public static java.lang.String dumpBytes(byte[] buffer,
                                         int offset,
                                         int length,
                                         boolean showAddr,
                                         boolean showChars,
                                         boolean lineFeed)
        Does a Hexadecimal/ASCII dump of a buffer. The format will be aaaaaaaa: bb bb bb bb bb bb bb bb bb bb bb bb bb bb bb bb cccccccccccccccc where aaaaaaaa is the address offset of the data, bb represents a byte of the data, and c is the ASCII character representing the data. ASCII values below 0x20 and above 0x7e are displayed as the '.' character.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to dump
        offset - The start offset of the data in the buffer
        length - The length of the data to dump
        showAddr - true to include the address
        showChars - true to dump ASCII characters
        lineFeed - true to add a line feed
        Returns:
        The dump String

      • hex

        public static java.lang.String hex(byte value)
        Converts a byte to a Hexadecimal String.
        Parameters:
        value - The byte to convert
        Returns:
        The Hexadecimal String

        public static java.lang.String hex(short value)
        Converts a short to a Hexadecimal String
        Parameters:
        value - The short to convert
        Returns:
        The Hexadecimal String

        Parameters:

        Returns:
